channel.title: Games At School
channel.description:
I haz a online 6th period APEX -History and i finished all of my second semester in the winter break and now i be playing games like CS 1.6 (counterstrike) and bf1942 (battlefield 1942) during 6th period Even our teacher plays (if not going home)
but im wondering why can you install cs1.6 but not bf1942 (i install on my computer and transfer all the files to usb and play off of it) Anyone know?

item.title: Games At School
item.dc:creator: @Kidpaparoach Kidpaparoach
item.description:
@Kidpaparoach wrote:

[quote=“Crown2, post:21, topic:435657”][quote author=t4 link=topic=538377.msg3939974#msg3939974 date=1331339003]
assuming you’re going for a science-based degree, uni is a lot of work, but a lot of freedom.
[/quote]
u in college t4[/quote]
Well known fact, uni is hard work but really relaxed. if you don’t put the effort in and fail there not going to make extra effort just for you. Personally i’d rather college, i like getting extra help

Read full topic

item.title: Games At School
item.dc:creator: @vManlyMan vManlyMan
item.description:
@vManlyMan wrote:

I have 1st hour CAD and 2nd hour Webmaster, so basically my first 2 periods are my gaming hours. Yesterday I beat Insane Aquarium, so now I need to bring a new game. Any suggestions?

Read full topic

item.title: Games At School
item.dc:creator: @whackatre Whackatre
item.description:
@whackatre wrote:

[quote=“zyle1992, post:11, topic:435657”][quote author=Crown2 link=topic=538377.msg3939191#msg3939191 date=1331270699]

why not just pay attention in class? i’m sure lots of tax payers (or parents in the case of private education) would be pretty angry if they knew you were wasting their money.

as i said i finished my 2nd semester before it started but still have to come to school 1 time per week and yah …

wasn’t exactly clear in OP. bring a laptop?

dont feel like carrying it all day ? and i haz pe 1st period get it jacked
[/quote]

Doesn’t PE usually give out lockers to each student? If all else fails, download a program, or slip in a GPS chip if it does get stolen.[/quote]

Wow, we don’t have to worry about theft in my school :S

Read full topic

item.title: Games At School
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

[quote=“Crown2, post:3, topic:435657”][quote author=SilentCJ link=topic=538377.msg3938860#msg3938860 date=1331254876]
Most likely because bf1942 installs values to the registry which are not moved when you copy the folder from program files.

Unless somebody out there has created a portable version of it (there are plenty of portable recent games that I have), you probably won’t be able to make it work.
[/quote]

that is what i think it is it dosen’t let you install things to registry but if you make your own custom portable version without registry i think it might work[/quote]
That would be correct.

Read full topic

item.title: Games At School
item.dc:creator: @Crown2 Crown2
item.description:
@Crown2 wrote:

[quote=“SilentCJ, post:2, topic:435657”]Most likely because bf1942 installs values to the registry which are not moved when you copy the folder from program files.

Unless somebody out there has created a portable version of it (there are plenty of portable recent games that I have), you probably won’t be able to make it work.[/quote]

that is what i think it is it dosen’t let you install things to registry but if you make your own custom portable version without registry i think it might work

Read full topic

Most likely because bf1942 installs values to the registry which are not moved when you copy the folder from program files.

Unless somebody out there has created a portable version of it (there are plenty of portable recent games that I have), you probably won’t be able to make it work.
